children.subject: My bad, the application form is linked here: https://docs.google.com/a/berkeley.edu/forms/d/1NUz47PCXHd8Jdxi5JqUEoU2EKChTq-p9wA_M-WXYK84/edit?usp=drivesdk
Fixed---now anyone with the link will be able to see it.

history.content:
Would you be interested in teaching data science?


 


The Data DeCal provides the skills and mentorship required to bridge the gap between class projects and personal projects. Over the course of the semester, students will learn research methods and complete a series of labs, culminating in a final project exploring an area of their interest.


 


We've re-designed the course for Spring 2020, and the new schedule and syllabus is linked here:
Schedule: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1yFhnsKUAjZzuEstyXXys8AvqhIHA5L-8EvPYV31p0qY/edit?usp=sharing


Syllabus: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_NAllwbYB59TXnkYRUoqgv7-H_hwa4ah4TBu1Jkjk4g/edit


 


Here are a list of roles we are recruiting for:


Teaching Assistant:
- Meet with and mentor students on their projects, discussing methods and approaches with them
- Prepare material for and/or lead discussion activities
- Opportunity to prepare and present a guest lecture on a topic of your interest


 


Liaison:
-Handle course logistics including: Getting guest speakers, recruiting course staff
-Manage campus outreach for the DeCal, and build possible collaborations with other DeCals and academic/campus groups.


 


Intern:
-Handling course grading of labs, exams, and projects
-Beta test course labs and exams before they are released
-Role is meant as an introductory teaching position, with the opportunity to transition into a TA role after a semester


 


You can receive 1 or 2 units for your contributions on course staff.


This course was offered in Fall 2019, and it has been approved for Spring 2020.


 


Applications are open and will be considered on a rolling basis. Applications will be due January 4th, 2020.


Apply here: 

https://docs.google.com/a/berkeley.edu/forms/d/1NUz47PCXHd8Jdxi5JqUEoU2EKChTq-p9wA_M-WXYK84/edit?usp=drivesdk



If you have any questions about the course or would like to know more about the positions, please email decal@db.berkeley.edu.
